title: What is with all this teemo hate lately??
body:
I just recently found the joys of being a satanic little hamster of tilt and have a shit ton of fun playing teemo and making plays with him. I am bronze 4 btw.

I was always under the impression that everyone thought teemo was an OP bastard.
Contrary to my belief, every single time I have picked teemo I get flamed at by my own team for picking someone "so useless" or someone will all chat from the other team laughing at my pick.... 9/10 I slaughter them and/or carry the game out. For example last game I got flamed for picking teemo into pantheon (which yes I know he is his counter but I for some reason don't always find a problem with path for him and I'm also on a mission to get mastery 7 with teems so I was going to play him in draft regardless) I proceeded to carry out that game with a score of 23/8/10 with three of my counters on the other side (yasuo, Malph, and panth) 

Can someone please explain where this hate came from and how come I can't seem to understand what people mean... every time I use him I have such great success. He's great at stopping DPS from adcs, he's great at punishing people out of position, he's great at denying CS to the top laner.. he has fucking free wards that do damage like plz someone explain

replies.body:
...lately?

No one has ever liked Teemo except those who play it.

As a support main, there are not many champs I'd dislike on my team more than Teemo. I literally have to pray to God that the enemy toplaner will lose hard, stay in lane the whole game and will have no efficient waveclear. 

Teemo is a great champ in lane. I can't argue about it. But outside of it... he's pretty useless. If you can abuse your advantage to the max and get out of lane far ahead - great! If not... well 4v5s are not my taste . So, I would much prefer to see a champ that is good even when he goes equal or behind and would have some teamfighting potential, as then even if he goes behind we could salvage the game as a group.

Edit: Also, you're at bronze 4. AFAIK the people there aren't the most calm and tolerant ones.

Playing devils advocate here because I totally understand your point 100% 

If teemo switches to an ADC play style and stays in the back and offers a blind to the teams adcs and also offers DOT with his autos would it still be a 4v5? Is your arguement more towards the fact that he's not a tank and unable to withstand late game power?? There's builds to counter that problem! Although not as good as full AP teemo, tankmo can still offer the blind and DOT to team fights for a couple of rotations without having to flee towards your back line. 

Sometimes I believe it really comes down to the teemo player themselves and their abiltiy to adapt to different situations and struggle to stay relevant. A well placed shroom can change the tide of a teamfight or even catch out that guy running off to the side to save himself!

I LOVE THE SONG CHOICEEEE!!!! <3 


Also.. I wanted to hate teemo for so long.. I didn't wanna be that guy(or girl in my case).. then I did it and I believe that I have already gone too far to turn back around now XD Satan has taken my souuuulllll
It's all honestly bandwagon hate..
That's what I thought but the bandwagon had to start somewhere!  I wonder where it started; someone in YouTube or something must of trash talked teems

yeah. some guy who's famous beat a bunch of players that were using teemo and recorded it. then there's all of the teemo trolling vids that make it seem like teemo is useless unless you're trolling then everybody who watched it got this warped impression that teemo is awful. in the lower tiers when you're stealthing or waiting on an enemy to walk over your shrooms people get pissy and call you an afk troll etc.

the truth is that teemo can literally make 60% of the champions in this game worthless. the only way to see teemo is with a vision ward if he's stealthed. the only reliable way to clear a path of shrooms is with oracle alteration. he's almost completely uncounterable if you're yi or another champion that relies on lock on abilities or basic attacks. the only people who can counter him are the ones with skill shots and aoe spells. you can sit there and wait for him to unstealth but if you do that you're just taking yourself out of the game. i literally sat in a bush with a yi for a good 30 minutes and almost won the game for my team because what was a 5v5 losing match became a 4v4 winning match since yi was so greedy. i made the mistake of killing him though and later died allowing him to wipe our inhibitors.
It alllll makes seeennnsee noooowwwwww!!

"lately"?

Teemo has been hated and perceived as a useless troll pick for.. what, 6 years?

He has zero value in high-ranked play, since he is basically incapable of teamfighting and cannot really splitpush as well as other splitpishers, but he is great for mindgaming bad players.

I actually do know that! I am a low Elo player though, where teemo is actually useful. I am bronze 4 right now that's kinda what I meant. 
Why is he perceived as bad for my low elo standing,  I fixed my board post so it includes my elo :)

(Although to add to this on Champion.gg he's Among the top ten performing top landers right now)

Teemo is going to slaughter in bronze 4. Any sort of mindgaming champion is hilariously overpowered there, because nobody wards or communicates, and they chase anything. You can just set up a shroom crashcourse and lead people through it.

Watching my friends play bronze V (i am S3) i am horrified and highly amused by the shit i see people do constantly, and the fact that nobody wards at all. They just charge straight into blind fights, 1v5 blind flashes into baron pit, trying to solo dragon at lv4, ect.

PS: try shaco.

Haha yeah that's exactly why I love teemo, being in that elo of course I'm guilty of those things too but I do know in the back of my mind they happen and punishing them are always a lot of fun haha 

Also I will take your suggestion to try shaco! :)
you're going to have a blast. he's harder, but way way way more fun. especially since you get your "shrooms" at level 1
I hope so!! Thank you again for the suggestion! ^-^

Well it's partially a meme, and partially because he doesn't offer much to team fighting. Champions nowadays have some kind utility towards teamfight or splitpushing, whereas Teemo is mostly good at AAing single targets 1v1.

He's good don't get me wrong, but you would never see him played in an LCS match or in higher ELO play because he's really easy to shut down/beat, and doesn't offer much to the team outside of his minefields. 

But don't let that stop you from playing him :) If you honestly enjoy playing Teemo then go for it! I personally like playing him in the jungle, even though he has no initation or utility :P I end up being more of a global ward with traps in the enemy jungle, super fun haha.

I agree 100% I think I'm going to try teemo jungle!! 
Thank you for being positive about keeping on with my teemo journey!

Haha no problem! I can give you some runes, masteries, and build path for Teemo jungle if you'd like :) Also shrooming areas, and where to start in jungle. 

You should never feel bad for playing who you want! It's a game so have fun with whoever :3 I like playing crazy off-meta styles myself. Like Blitz Jungle or Thresh ADC. Super fun and makes the game way more enjoyable.

I used to play with someone who was strict off meta, best riven and lux jungle I have ever seen in my entire life XD he was so good at it! 

And that would be great if you could!! I've actually been trying to find some teemo jungle guides and I can't really find any I trust.

No problem!

For runes you're going to want to take 9 Marks of Attack Speed, 7 Seals of Armor and 2 Seals of Attack speed, 4 Glyphs of AP and 5 Glyphs of MR, and 3 Quints of Ability Power.

Masteries are: 12/18/0 

Take Sorcery, Feast, Natural Talent, and Oppressor for Ferocity.
Take Wanderer, Secret Stash, Merciless, Dangerous Game, Precision, and Thunderlord's Decree. 

For builds you'll do {{item:1414}}  or {{item:1402}} . I prefer Stalker's but that's up to you. 
Core items will be {{item:3151}} {{item:3116}} and {{item:3085}} . All else is situational. Boots are always {{item:3020}} . 

For starting in the jungle I highly recommend going with Q and starting Krugs. The stun + blind really helps you clear camps considering how squishy you are. 

I suggest doing Krugs, Red, and the Scuttle for that extra heal and vision. Move to blue and get Gromp, Blue, and the other Scuttle if you have enough health. Basic jungle strat is good for him, just be careful on your health and possible invades. 

Ganking you don't need to worry about, but only gank if the enemy is over extending and your ally has a good form of CC. 

You'll mostly want to focus on laying your shrooms in good locations (pushes and paths frequently traveled) and you'll want to ward a lot for your team. You wont be able to provide good ganks, but you can really help your team by creating a lot of vision. Pinks and your trinket ward work just fine with your shrooms. 

I hope that helps :D He's super fun to play in the jungle. And that build/runes/masteries works for top as well. 

Good luck!

lately.

thats funny. hes been despised since the first days of this game. if youve ever seen the phases where he was a regular pick youd understand why.

his kit is uninteractive as fuck. it lacks counterplay (no sweeper at lvl 9 on a 90 second cooldown is not a viable form of counterplay). he is opressive as hell in lane against a lot of matchups. he drags out games. his lategame is nothing but splitpushing.

people hate having him on his team, because most teemos are fucking useless. and people hate playing against him because even winning against him feels like a constant uphill battle and like a chore.

I only say lately because I have never seen the hate before; I was unaware it was an ongoing thing to think he was useless.. the only thing I had ever seen before I used him was people talking about how annoying he is to verse. Maybe I just took that as people thought he was strong and not just annoying lmao 

He does have counterplay though;!l he can be zoned out and bursted so incredibly fast if you don't prepare for that to happen to you.

except that hes usually the one zoning and bursting.

his q deals a metric fuckton of damage from range while the blind is preventing you to fight back in a lot of cases. sweeper at lvl 9 on one person isnt enough to deal with his shrooms during the lane phase.

his entire playstile early on is poke and run, which is incredibly hard to deal with at that stage if youre not playing a hypermobile assassin. even if you do, you have to expect that hes sitting in a nest of shrooms.

hes just overall extremely frustrating to deal with at all stages of the game.
i just beat him down toplane with kled, heres how the lane went, i walked to lane, there was a teemo, i got first blood, i beat him down somemore i buy items i cast my ult on plebs.

The champion has been 'hated' for a loooong time.  Most hate playing against him because his kit is so troll-ish.  His autos poison you, so one or two autos and your life bar starts to melt.  He can blind you so if you're an AA champ, you're screwed.  He has a speed burst and is ranged, so he can kite.  He can go invis and just wait...  And those shrooms... you THINK you've gotten away... POMF/DEAD.

And that laugh...

And the fact that, team fight wise, he really doesn't bring anything to the table.

With that said, in the right hands, he can be a monster.
It's an old meme, really.

its just the champion in general. See also {{champion:11}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:105}}. Champs that are annoying to play against and when they on your team they either do well and carry hard making the game feel cheesy or they feed like crazy and make it an annoying experience.
